Bhutan: A district court interprets the constitutional clause regarding religious "coercion or inducement" to prohibit not only forced conversion but also proselytism in the case of a Christian missionary pastor who used a generator and a projector in a private home on 21 May 2009. The pastor received a sentence of three years imprisonment for infringing the Constitution.
Parliament enacts the Tobacco Control Act, restricting import and possession, and banning the sale of tobacco in Bhutan.
